intro: Boehmeria subperforata, commonly known as Chinese nettle or Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive net-veined pattern. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes. Its fibrous stalks are used in traditional textiles and papermaking due to their strength and durability. Boehmeria subperforata is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
